name: NPR
text: At least 71 nations have already imposed limitations or full bans on exports of essential COVID-19 supplies â€” forcing many of the poorest countries into bidding wars over highly urgent, highly priced medical products. https://t.co/9WhrEKC60o

name: NPR
text:
From the adoption of a teenage daughter to the birth of a baby boy, here are a few of the best things that happened to @NPRItsBeenAMin listeners this week.

Check out the podcast at https://t.co/uq1X48zQdp. https://t.co/2YuA4kGMga

name: NPR
text:
Stephania Ergemlidze has been bringing a portable basketball hoop to protests. 

"Obviously, basketball is not going to solve the problem," she says. "We were more looking towards trying to ease the tension ... that way, maybe messages can get across." https://t.co/P3bwgH0Wsc

name: NPR
text: "I don't necessarily agree with defunding police," says Memphis Police Association President Michael Williams, but he agrees "whole-heartedly" that the city's budget isn't equitably spread to address the needs of the people of Memphis. https://t.co/zvjVUy02SR

name: NPR
text:
Author Liara Tamani: "Even when things seem to be going terrible in the world .... I want teens to remember to look to the blue sky for peace. To listen to the birds and pay attention to the trees. Simple things, but they can be transcendent."
https://t.co/zJPgPlrZ5R

name: NPR
text: Polish soldiers mistakenly crossed the border into the Czech Republic and stopped people on the wrong side. Both coâ€¦ https://t.co/LF9fJBHE7o

name: NPR
text:
The Democratic Republic of the Congo spends $19 per citizen on health care annually. 

In the U.S., the number is nearly $10,000. 

While experts warn that higher health spending doesn't necessarily lead to better outcomes, it helps in a pandemic. https://t.co/zLIarJjYsL

name: NPR
text:
Ella Jones, who will be the first black and first female mayor of Ferguson, Mo., says the city has seen widespread reforms since the police killing of Michael Brown. But it still needs to "strive toward a better image."
https://t.co/oIBB3IVTwx

name: NPR
text:
The Trump administration has proposed new rules that would sharply restrict how asylum is granted to immigrants seeking protection in the U.S.

Critics say the rules are so severe they would effectively shut down the U.S. asylum system.
https://t.co/oyMG9jxArT

name: NPR
text: Ashima Shiraishi has won rock climbing championships, set records â€” and done it all before the age of 20. So @waitwait invited her to play a game called "Let's take the easy way up" â€” 3 questions about escalators. https://t.co/r36fBmFEqh

name: NPR
text:

name: NPR
text: In a new, scrupulously reported biography, reporter Mary Jordan writes that Melania Trump used the fact that her husband needed her public loyalty after he was accused of infidelity and assault to negotiate a better prenup. https://t.co/FdCQxo3Lfo
